"description": " It is the date when we expect to make the decision as whether or not we will submit our offer for this bid.",
"description": "Represents the opportunity category which is a picklist value. The values are Simple, Object and Master",

"description": "Represents the Channel Type. Select Direct if the Oppty Account will purchase through SE directly by giving us the Order to fulfill. Select Indirect if the Oppty Account will purchase through 3rd party like a distributor or reselle",
"description": "Represents the Project Category P0. It is a picklist which can include A, B, C and D",
"description": "Represents the Market Sub-Segment (Opportunity). Some of the values from picklist are B43, I44, I39 etc",
"description": "It is the date when we expect to make the decision as whether or not we will participate to this bid.",
"description": "the name of the Legacy CRM system where applicable to the opportunity. Most of the time this is used for migration of data.",
"description": "SE Business Unit which is in charge of managing the opportunity and project through its phases until completion. It is a picklist value",
"description": " It shows the lead we had or received for this opportunity (either from direct marketing or event, campaign, etc). It is a picklist value",
"description": "Define a specific, time-sensitive deadline by which the Account expects a quote to be sent.",
"description": "Date when the gate S1 passed (automatically filled-in by the system)",
"description": "This is a date where the opportunity team should conduct a follow up with the account to determine any changes to the opportunity.",

"description": "It is a free text field where the opportunity owner will mention what s/he will do in the future. It is for Salesperson to remember something or for manager to be aware what follows.",
"description": "Represents the Opportunity Priority Level. Picklist value",
"description": "Represents the date when SE promised to send the quote to the Account. This date has been previously agreed with Solution Center/Quotation Center.",
"description": "The Opportunity Detector will ensure that the correct resource receives credit for identifying the Opportunity (mainly for lead & service teams).",
"description": "It is the date when we expect to have the opportunity qualified and make the decision as whether or not we will pursue this opportunity.",

"description": " It shows the privacy level for the information recorded within the opportunity. It doesn't mean that the details will be hidden only draw attention about the confidentiality level of the data.",

"description": "Represents the Included in Reporting.For a given level in the opportunity hierarchy, only one opportunity can be included in the forecast and then Opportunity information will show up in forecast reports allowing management to understand and predict potential future revenue",

url.raw: https://api.qa.se.com/v1/sales-operation/opportunity/opportunities/recent?filter=destinationCountry LIKE 'Japan' AND currencyCode = 'JPY' AND opportunityName LIKE '%LRMZE%' AND amount > 1888

query.value: destinationCountry LIKE 'Japan' AND currencyCode = 'JPY' AND opportunityName LIKE '%LRMZE%' AND amount > 1888

query.value: destinationCountry LIKE 'USA' AND currencyCode = 'USD' AND opportunityName LIKE '%Allure%' AND amount > "1888"

exec: "description": "Represents the name of the related list",

"description": "Represents the count of related list on each object. On Child-Opportunity, Event and Task related objects, the number of records which are Open will be returned.  Open Child Opportunities = 1 - Understand Business Context,2 - Define Opportunity Portfolio,3 - Identify & Qualify,4 - Influence & Develop,5 - Prepare & Bid,6 - Negotiate to Win,  Open Sales Events = Planned, Confirmed and Rescheduled,  Open  Task = Not Started, In Progress, Waiting on Someone Else and Deferred",

query.value: destinationCountry LIKE 'USA' AND currencyCode = 'USD' AND opportunityName LIKE '%Allure%' AND amount > "1888"
